name: Tunnicliff Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inn is a nice old inn, just off Main Street in Cooperstown. The location is great, the staff was quite nice. The room was fine... but the floors were slanted, which was a little jarring. The price was very reasonable, and surprise included a lovely breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Fine little in with great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a restaurant downstairs with no ambiance but great burgers.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed here while visting the Baseball Hall of Fame. After a long bus ride from NYC we were pleasently surprised with our stayed in a Standard King Room on the 3rd floor. The room was spacious & bed was very comfortable! Only beware is the narrow staircase, especially if your on the 3rd floor. But it would not prevent me from choosing the room again. The staff was very pleasent. There was a hot buffet breakfast in the morning that was VERY yummy! There is also a resturant in the basement of the Inn, which had a delicious dinner. Cooperstown is a small town, but Tunnicliff seems to be perfectly placed in the middle of town. Almost everything we needed was in walking distance. The hall of fame is less than a 5 min walk. We would love to return her one day!!
reviews.title: Tunnicliff Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights 4 days. Had a very nice time. Hotel staff was very accommodating Room was nice funiture but kept with the historical setting. Clean, Free Breakfast was fantastic. with a hot food bar each day. Very nice atmosphere. ONe thing was the slanted floors but we loved them It showed the charactor of the old hotel. You would be slanted if you were 200+ years old. BAthrooms were neat and clean and had level floors. YOU could tell the bathrooms were newly installed. Would recommend this hotel and we would and will go back.
reviews.title: perfect for us!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't have been more pleased. The charm of the 209 year old building, the convenient location to everything, the incredibly friendly people, and free parking with everything in walking distance. Lovely breakfast buffet included. Would definitely go back!!!
reviews.title: Location good, but rather shabby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: This was my second time staying at the Tunnicliff (10/1/11) and I agree with all of the positive commrnts others have mentioned. Unless you were playing marbles I cannot see where a slanted floor has anything to do with your stay. Granted the shower is quite small, but certainly something you can live with, unless you are planning to live in it for your stay. Location is about the best you can find in Cooperstown. I like the idea of parking my car and not needing it for a couple of days. Room was very comfortable and the staff is great - not very talkative but just the opposite can be quite a drag. Good selection at breakfast. As one person mentioned the stairs (outside and between floors) can be tough to navigate. I only wish I could have a room there during the Induction Day Weekend!
reviews.title: I'll Be bACK!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last Wednesday and Thursday. The hotel is older and the floor creaks but the service was great, the room was very clean and the bed was great. Parking was tight but the location to the HOF is great. We also ate at the restaurant on Thursday ordering their specials. Both of us thought the meal was really good especially for the price.
reviews.title: great location, great price, excellent breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I think they must've fixed the place up since the bad reviews were written, because my room was very nice. The location is great and the breakfast was very good, too. It DOES still have a pretty lousy old carpet in the lobby, and yes, the floors are uneven. But as for the floor, well, it's a very old house, and anyway as I say the room was outstanding. The staff are not friendly; they carry out their business in an efficient way, but respond to any attempts at conversation with grunts, and answer questions in a perfunctory manner. If you want a comfortable place to stay near the Hall, though, this is a good one overall.
reviews.title: Good location, nice room & breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tunnicliff Inn is a good place to stay when visiting Cooperstown; it is within a few hundred feet of the Baseball Hall of Fame, beautiful Lake Otsego and many shops and restaurants. Room was spacious,with a radiator, window ac, very small bath with tiny shower,(other rooms in the front of the inn are larger and have a better view. There is a limited ite breakfast buffet.Employees were friendly and helpful. There were a couple of issues however; there are very high steps to gain access to the front entrance, old, creaky, steep steps to the room we had on the 2nd floor and then a circular stairway to the 3d floor--no elevator. Anyone with mobility issues should find another accommodation. Parking is free in back of the inn.We had a twin room which was converted to a king; the room was a bit oddly configured with different floor levels and ceiling heights.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was only fair--too many high caloric offerings, very little fruit and no yogurt. The main restaurant is open only on Tu-Sat but the downstairs Pub (the Pit) offers food and drink on Sun and Mon. Food there was overpriced, oversalted, poorly prepared and definitely not appetizing.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Arriving in Cooperstown after a very long drive, we asked a worker at an Info booth on Main St. where was a good place to stay for the evening. We asked about the Otesaga ($350-400) and she suggested the Tunnicliff which was about 40 feet away. Not fancy, very old but clean warm and reasonably priced. Real fun!
reviews.title: A Respite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights while visiting the Baseball Hall of Fame. We loved the location. Easy walking around town for eating, shopping, and the Hall of Fame. Close to lake. Some may like a more modern hotel but this hotel was perfect for us. The room was adequate, clean, and affordable. Tthe breakfast good! The manager made check in very easy.
reviews.title: Loved the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Tunnicliff Inn has about the best location you could want in Cooperstown--very short walking distances to almost everything you would want to see...and there is free parking.
reviews.title: Quaint hotel with great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn is cobbled together from at least two older buildings. Rooms reflect the yesteryear feeling of the place, but they have full service Direct TV, DVD players and a DVD library. The Inn provides an EXCELLENT breakfast including scrambled eggs cooked right, great breakfast potatoes, sausage, pancakes, fruit...the works. Not everything was right in our room when we checked in, but the manager is very friendly and on the spot to fix whatever needs fixing.
reviews.title: Location was fantastic, but that was about it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: For the price I do not think you can do better in Cooperstown.
reviews.title: So dowdy, location is only reason to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A little expensive, but you're paying for the location. Easy walking distance to both the Hall of Fame and the lake. Clean, comfortable room. Excellent breakfast included in the price.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: It's amazing to me that the most reviews for this property are either "5 star - best ever" or "1 star - worst ever." The truth, as always, lies somewhere in between. LOCATION: This hotel is essentially across the street from the Baseball Hall of Fame and a short walk from restaurants and shops, which makes it's location perfect...well sort of. It's close to everything, but because it's right in the commercial district, it doesn't have the quiet residential location of the Cooper Inn, the Inn at Cooperstown, or the Otesaga. PRICE: It doesn't have the quiet residential location of the Cooper Inn, the Inn at Cooperstown, or the Otesaga, but it doesn't have their pricetags either! The price was the best deal in town...simple as that. This is not a town with many real values, and if price is a main consideration for you, you should consider the Tunnicliff. ROOMS: How anyone can complain about slanted floors and narrow rickety staircases in a 19th century building is beyond me. However, there are some things lacking that should be within the control of management. Overall cleanliness was so-so. No bugs, no major problems, but the linens are not crisp and the carpets could be shampooed. SERVICE: There is rarely anyone at the front desk, but for us, once checked in, that was not a major problem. The attitude of the staff was not solicitous, but not rude either. There is private parking and a nice full breakfast served in a pleasant setting. SUMMARY: As I said, if location and price are your main considerations, the Tunnicliff is a good choice. You will not get the quiet, beautiful elegance of some of the other choices, but in a town of $300+ summer rates, $185 for a large King room with a full breakfast is a deal.
reviews.title: Not the best, not the worst - Location and price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: Clean, quiet, perfect locale, and great breakfast! A little pricey?
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, perfect locale, and great breakfast! A little pricey?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: We stayed the Thursday before hall of fame weekend. The city was very busy already. The young man at the front desk was very polite and helpful. Our room was very small but we knew that when booking. It is a very old building with lots of character. The location is perfect. Near shops and the water. We had dinner on site. Good value and quality food. The breakfast is also good. Hot full buffet style.
reviews.title: Best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Tunnicliff Inn when visting for two days on our way to Boston and Maine. We wanted to stay someplace different than the run of the mill chain hotels and this definitely fit the bill. Our kids (ages 11 and 12) and my husband and I all stayed in the Executive king room. Our kids were provided with 2 rollaway beds and we were all very comfortable and cozy. The room had a lot of character including slanted floors and ceilings which made it seem like we were staying in a comfortable old house belonging to a long lost relative. The room was very clean and the staff very nice. The bathroom was very small and the shower even smaller but it was fine for our family. The breakfast was nice and there was a good selection. The location was PERFECT and close to everything so we were able to walk to everything in town. As a warning though this hotel would be very difficulty to navigate if you had any disability because of the stairs.
reviews.title: Loved it but probably not for everyone

description: Historic Inn built in 1802. Located in the center of downtown Cooperstown. Only 498 Feet from the Baseball Hall of Fame. All Rooms include our Free Hot Breakfast Buffet and Free Wi-Fi. 17 Rooms each with a Private Bathroom, Air Conditioning, Television, DVD Player, Hairdryer, Iron, Telephone, Radio Alarm Clock and Ceiling Fan. Mini-Fridge and coffee makers in our Executive rooms and Suites. Family Restaurant on premise serves Lunch and Dinner.
